* * WebAuthn API Check * * Check whether the WebAuthn API is available and submit the corresponding * boolean value to advance the flow. * */ /** * If the browser doesn't support WebAuthn, then set the value of the hidden * input field to false and submit the form. If the browser does support * WebAuthn, then set the value of the hidden input field to true and submit the * form * * @returns A boolean value representing WebAuthn API support. */ const webAuthnCheck = () => { if (!window.PublicKeyCredential) { document.getElementById('webAuthnSupport').value = false; document.getElementById('webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn').click(); return false; } document.getElementById('webAuthnSupport').value = true; document.getElementById('webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn').click(); return true; }; /** * Wait for page to load to start the FIDO authentication process */ if (document.readyState === 'loading') { // Loading hasn't finished yet document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', webAuthnCheck); } else { // `DOMContentLoaded` has already fired const webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn = document.getElementById( 'webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn' ); if (webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn) { webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn.addEventListener('click', webAuthnCheck); } return webAuthnCheck(); } "},"customHTML":{"value":"

* * FIDO Authentication * * Performs FIDO authentication using the WebAuthn API given public key * credentials option saved as a flow instance variable. * */ /** * If the string is valid JSON, parse it and return the object. If it's not * valid JSON, return the string * * @param strVal - The stringified JSON object that you want to parse. * @returns The parsed JSON as an object. */ const parseJSONIfNeeded = (strVal) => { try { return JSON.parse(strVal); } catch (error) { if (error.name === 'SyntaxError') { if (error.message === '"[object Object]" is not valid JSON') { // In most cases, this means that the method argument was given as a // JSON object, so we can just proceed. // But, you can add debugging here if you need to investigate further. return strVal; } else { // This means that we didn't get an object passed into the method as // an object and there's a syntax problem with it. throw new Error( 'JSON parsing failed due to improper JSON syntax found in public key credential request options string.', {cause: error} ); } } else { // This is unexpected and needs further debugging. throw new Error('Unexpected error. Please try again.', { cause: error, }); } } }; /** * It resets the error message element's text to an empty string */ const resetErrorMessageText = () => { const errorMsgElement = document.getElementById('errorMsg'); if (errorMsgElement) { errorMsgElement.innerHTML = ''; } }; /** * Updates the error message element with passed in message * * @param message - The message to display in the error message element. * @returns True if message is updated, and false otherwise. */ const updateErrorMessageText = (message) => { const errorMsgElement = document.getElementById('errorMsg'); if (errorMsgElement) { errorMsgElement.innerHTML = message; return true; } return false; }; /** * It converts a list of credentials from the format given in the public key * credentials object to the format used by the WebAuthn API * * @param list - The list of credentials to convert. * @returns An array of credential objects which includes the type of * credential and its ID */ const credentialListConversion = (list) => { const credList = []; for (let i = 0; i < list.length; i++) { const cred = { type: list[i].type, id: new Uint8Array(list[i].id), }; if (list[i].transports) { cred.transports = list[i].transports; } credList.push(cred); } return credList; }; /** * It takes an object with the following properties: * * - challenge * - allowCredentials * - timeout * * And returns an object with the following properties: * * - challenge * - allowCredentials * - timeout * * The only difference is that the challenge property is converted from a base64 * encoded string to a Uint8Array using @see {@link credentialListConversion} * * @param options - A public key credential request options object * @returns A publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions object with allowCredentials * converted into a Uint8Array. */ const buildPubKeyRequestOptions = (options) => { const publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions = {}; if (options.challenge) { publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions.challenge = new Uint8Array( options.challenge ); } else { throw new Error('Missing challenge from options'); } if (options.allowCredentials) { publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions.allowCredentials = credentialListConversion(options.allowCredentials); } else { throw new Error('Missing allowCredentials from options'); } if (options.timeout) { publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions.timeout = options.timeout; } else { throw new Error('Missing timeout from options'); } return publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions; }; /** * It converts a binary array to a base64 string * * @param bin - The binary data to convert to base64. * @returns A string of base64 encoded data. */ const toBase64Str = (bin) => { return btoa(String.fromCharCode.apply(null, new Uint8Array(bin))); }; /** * It takes a FIDO assertion object and returns a public key credential object * * @param assertion - The FIDO assertion object returned from the authenticator. * @returns A [PublicKeyCredential]{@link https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn-2/#iface-pkcredential} object */ const createPubliCKeyCredential = (assertion) => { const publicKeyCredential = {}; const response = {}; // Pull values from assertion to create public key credential if (assertion.id) { publicKeyCredential.id = assertion.id; } if (assertion.rawId) { publicKeyCredential.rawId = toBase64Str(assertion.rawId); } if (assertion.type) { publicKeyCredential.type = assertion.type; } // Create response object response.clientDataJSON = toBase64Str(assertion.response.clientDataJSON); response.authenticatorData = toBase64Str( assertion.response.authenticatorData ); response.signature = toBase64Str(assertion.response.signature); response.userHandle = toBase64Str(assertion.response.userHandle); // Add response object to public key credential object publicKeyCredential.response = response; return publicKeyCredential; }; /** * It takes the options that were sent from the server, builds a public key * credential request, and then uses the WebAuthn API to get a FIDO assertion * * @param options - The public key credential request options that are passed to the getFIDOAssertion function * @returns The FIDO assertion if authentication is successful */ const getFIDOAssertion = async (options) => { // Try to parse options in case they were sent in string form options = parseJSONIfNeeded(options); // Build the public key to pass into the WebAuthn API's // [navigator.credentials.get()]{@link https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn-2/#sctn-getAssertion} // call using the passed in public key credential request options. const publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions = buildPubKeyRequestOptions(options); // Use WebAuthn API to get a FIDO assertion try { const assertion = await navigator.credentials.get({ publicKey: publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions, }); // Construct, in order to send to the server to validate, a // [PublicKeyCredential]{@link https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn-2/#iface-pkcredential} // object to the server for verification and registration. const publicKeyCredential = createPubliCKeyCredential(assertion); // Sets the assertion value document.getElementById('assertionValue').value = JSON.stringify(publicKeyCredential); // Submit the assertion value and advance the flow document.getElementById('assertionButton').click(); return JSON.stringify(publicKeyCredential); } catch (error) { // No acceptable authenticator or user refused consent. Cancel authentication throw new Error( 'Failed to generate an assertion through FIDO authentication.', { cause: error, } ); } }; /** * It takes the public key credential request options from the flow instance * variable and uses them to request an assertion from the FIDO authenticator * * @param event - The event object that is passed to the function. * @returns The FIDO assertion object or false if FIDO * authentication failed */ const fidoAuthn = async (event) => { event?.preventDefault(); const publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions = '{{global.variables.publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions}}'; let assertion; resetErrorMessageText(); if (publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions) { try { assertion = await getFIDOAssertion(publicKeyCredentialRequestOptions); return assertion; } catch (error) { updateErrorMessageText(error, {cause: error}); return false; } } else { // Missing Public Key Credential request Options updateErrorMessageText('Missing credential request options'); } return false; }; /** * Wait for page to load to start the FIDO authentication process */ if (document.readyState === 'loading') { // Loading hasn't finished yet document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', fidoAuthn); } else { // `DOMContentLoaded` has already fired const fidoBtn = document.getElementById('fidoButton'); if (fidoBtn) { fidoBtn.addEventListener('click', fidoAuthn); } return fidoAuthn(); } "},"customHTML":{"value":"

Authenticate with your Device

"},"formFieldsList":{"value":[{"preferredControlType":"textField","preferredDataType":"string","propertyName":"buttonValue"},{"propertyName":"assertionValue","preferredControlType":"textField","preferredDataType":"string","value":"","hashedVisibility":false}]},"nodeTitle":{"value":"Perform FIDO authentication"},"nodeDescription":{"value":"Starts the FIDO authentication process by calling the WebAuthn API"},"customCSS":{"value":".hidden-button{ display: none; } nodeDescription.value: Initialize common values used in the flow so that they're easier to update in one place

customHTML.value: Sign On

nodeDescription.value: Form to get the user's username that they're trying to login with
Searches for the user in PingOne's cloud directory
Something went wrong when trying to find the user in PingOne matching the given username

customHTML.value:
<form
  id="webAuthnSupportForm"
  method="post"
>
  <input
    type="hidden"
    name="webAuthnSupport"
    id="webAuthnSupport"
  />
  <button
    type="hidden"
    data-skcomponent="skbutton"
    data-skbuttontype="form-submit"
    class="hidden-button"
    data-skbuttonvalue="submit"
    data-skform="webAuthnSupportForm"
    id="webAuthnSupportSubmitBtn"
  ></button>
</form>

nodeDescription.value: Tries to call the WebAuthn API to see if we can use it for FIDO authentication
Sends the FIDO assertion to PingOne MFA to validate
Saves the value representing whether WebAuthn API is callable
